intro: Sideritis cavanillesii, commonly known as the Balkan ironweed, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Europe. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its medicinal uses. Sideritis cavanillesii is valued for its potential health benefits, including anti-inflammatory and antioxidant properties.
